speech: The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Programâ€™s (SNAP) Employment & Training (E&T) program is an invaluable resource in assisting eligible SNAP recipients to become work and/or career ready in a middle-skill occupation. To maximize limited resources and expand E&T services, MDHS forms partnerships with other agencies and organizations to provide education, training, and supportive services to eligible SNAP E&T participants.

Able Bodied Adults without Dependents (ABAWD) have an opportunity to participate in Skills2Work and certain SNAP populations are eligible to volunteer for SNAP E&T services. The goal of Skills2Work (S2W) is to help eligible SNAP recipients gain access to education and/or training opportunities in order to earn credentials that will help them compete for employer-driven, middle-skill jobs. Skills2Work will focus on career/technical and/or workforce skills training programs.
What can I help you with?
